conclusion: Understanding the motion of the charged particle in the magnetic fields.
The period T of a charged particle in a magnetic field is given by T = 2πm/qB.
Calculate the period in magnetic field B1: T1 = πm/qB2.
Calculate the period in magnetic field B2: T2 = 2πm/qB2.
The particle enters B1 and moves in a circular path with period T1.
After exiting B1 and entering B2, it moves in a circular path with period T2.
The particle's path forms a heart shape.
The particle must complete three-quarters of a circle in B1 and one quarter in B2 to return to point O downward.
Total time t is the sum of t1 and t2: t = 5πm/4qB2.
The time it takes for the particle to pass through point O downward again is 5πm/4qB2.
